content.title: Welcome to ClearTriage's Security and Privacy Awareness Training
content.content:
Welcome to ClearTriage's **Security & Privacy Awareness Training**! üéâ

content.title: Scope & Context
content.content:
Our FedRAMP authorization (once approved ‚Äî thanks **ScaleSec**!) will cover:

1. **ClearTriage app** ‚Äì running in a FedRAMP-approved AWS environment
2. **Google Drive** ‚Äì used for work documentation

**Why this matters**:

- We build for the **VA**, so security is non-negotiable.
- We *don't* handle PII/PHI, but our code & configs still need protection.
- In a 6-person company **everyone is on the security team** ‚Äì Pete just wears the captain‚Äôs hat üß¢ (when he finds it).

Let‚Äôs dive in and map everything to the FedRAMP *Awareness and Training (AT)* controls.

content.title: AT-1: Security Awareness & Training Policy Overview
content.content:
We maintain a formal **Security & Privacy Awareness and Training Policy** (because even a tiny startup needs paperwork üìÑ).

It:

- Defines roles & responsibilities
- Specifies required training frequency
- Outlines how we track completion & effectiveness

content.title: Policy Documentation & Access
content.content:
You can always find the latest "ClearTriage Security Training Policy" inside **Google Drive**.

Need a link? Ask **Shelly** (FedRAMP Coordinator & organizer-in-chief).

No departments, no excuses ‚Äî Pete makes sure each of the six of us gets the doc (sometimes he even offers donuts üç© as incentive).

content.title: Training Management
content.content:
- **Pete** develops & updates training materials
- Everyone completes training on time (peer pressure helps)
- Our size means no one falls through the cracks ‚Äî if you skip training, we‚Äôll all know!

content.title: Policy Review Schedule
content.content:
- **Annual check-up** by Pete
- **Formal refresh** at least every **3 years** (FedRAMP minimum)
- Faster updates if something major changes

content.title: Procedure Updates
content.content:
Procedures are updated **at least yearly** and **whenever**:

- We add a new tool
- Savvy unleashes fresh DevOps magic
- A significant security incident occurs
- FedRAMP requirements change

content.title: Change Communication
content.content:
When policy/procedures change, Pete:

1. Sends a summary email *or* hosts a 15-min all-hands
2. Ensures every team member understands the updates

content.title: Ask Questions!
content.content:
Keep it simple ‚Äî **ask questions!**

A ‚Äúdumb‚Äù question beats a ‚Äúdumb‚Äù security mistake every day.

content.title: Why This Matters
content.content:
A solid policy is our **playbook**:

- Demonstrates management commitment
- Keeps us accountable
- Impresses auditors (yay!)

Reading a few paragraphs now beats dealing with a security fiasco later. üòâ
